017package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.data;
018
019import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
020import java.io.BufferedReader;
021import java.io.File;
022import java.io.FileInputStream;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.io.InputStreamReader;
025import java.io.Reader;
026import java.nio.charset.Charset;
027import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import java.util.Collections;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Objects;
033import java.util.regex.Pattern;
034import java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream;
035
036/**Wraps degreedays.net hourly temperature CSV data to make it clear what it is; data cannot be null.
037 * Note that neither rows nor fields can be null, but may be empty.
038 * <p>
039 * Data sample:
040<pre>
041Description:,"Hourly temperatures in Celsius"
042Source:,"www.degreedays.net"
043Accuracy:,"Estimates were made to account for missing data: the ""% Estimated"" column shows how much each figure was affected (0% is best, 100% is worst)"
044Station:,"London, GB (0.45W,51.48N)"
045Station ID:,EGLL
046
047Datetime,Timezone,Date,Time,Temp (<B0>C),% Estimated
0482018-01-01 00:00,GMT,2018-01-01,00:00,7,0
0492018-01-01 01:00,GMT,2018-01-01,01:00,7,0
0502018-01-01 02:00,GMT,2018-01-01,02:00,6.3,0
0512018-01-01 03:00,GMT,2018-01-01,03:00,6,0
052</pre>
053 */
054public record DDNTemperatureDataCSV(List<List<String>> data)
055    {
056        public DDNTemperatureDataCSV { Objects.requireNonNull(data); }
057
058        /**If true, attempt to minimise memory consumption when parsing and loading EOUDATACSV data. */
059        private static final boolean OPTIMISE_MEMORY_IN_CSV_PARSE = true;
060
061        /**Charset for degreedays.net hourly temperature data CSV format (ISO-Latin-1 for degree symbol 0xB0). */
062        public static final Charset TEMPDATACSV_CHARSET = StandardCharsets.ISO_8859_1;
063
064        /**Immutable regex pattern used to split CSV lines; never null.
065         * This is basically just a simple ","
066         * which with split() should preserve empty fields.
067         */
068        public static final Pattern delimCSV = Pattern.compile(",");
069
070        /**Index of key temperature field (C) in each data row; positive. */
071        public static final int INDEX_OF_TEMPERATURE = 4;
072
073        /**Default path to temperature data directory from project root; non-null. */
074    public static final File DEFAULT_PATH_TO_TEMPERATURE_DATA = new File("data/temperature");
075
076    /**Sample data set in default directory: EGLL (LHR/Heathrow) for 2018 as ~median HDD (12) from 2008 to 2022. */
077    public static final File DATA_EGLL_2018 = new File(DEFAULT_PATH_TO_TEMPERATURE_DATA, "EGLL_CelsiusTemps_2018_extract.csv.gz");
078
079    /**Sample data set in default directory: EGPF (GLA/Glasgow) for 2018. */
080    public static final File DATA_EGPF_2018 = new File(DEFAULT_PATH_TO_TEMPERATURE_DATA, "EGPF_CelsiusTemps_2018_extract.csv.gz");
081
082        /**Default path to 201X decade temperature data directory from project root; non-null. */
083    public static final File PATH_TO_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA = new File(DEFAULT_PATH_TO_TEMPERATURE_DATA, "201X");
084    /**Tail of filename for 201X temperature data files; non-null. */
085    public static final String FILE_TAIL_FOR_201X_TEMPERATURE_FILE = "_CelsiusTemps_201X_extract.csv.gz";
086
087    /**Expected number of records in each of the 201X data files. */
088    public static final int RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA = 87648;
089
090    /**Data descriptors for 201X temperature dataset; non-null. */
091    public static final List<HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor> DESCRIPTORS_201X_DATASET =
092                Collections.unmodifiableList(Arrays.asList(new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor[] {
093                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGAA", "Belfast", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA),
094                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGCC", "Manchester", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA),
095                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGFF", "Cardiff", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA),
096                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGLL", "London", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA),
097                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGNT", "Newcastle", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA),
098                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGPF", "Glasgow", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA),
099                        new HourlyTemperatureDataDescriptor("EGPH", "Edinburgh", RECORD_COUNT_201X_TEMPERATURE_DATA)
100                }));
101
102        /**Parse degreedays.net hourly temperature CSV file/stream; never null but may be empty.
103     * Parses CSV as List (by row) of List (of String fields),
104     * omitting empty and comment (starting with '#') rows.
105     * <p>
106     * This <em>does not</em> validate the content.
107     * </p>
108     * The outer and inner Lists implement RandomAccess.
109     * <p>
110     * This buffers its input for efficiency if not already a BufferedReader.
111     *
112     * @param r  stream to read from, not closed by this routine; never null
113     * @return a non-null but possibly-empty in-order immutable List of rows,
114     *    each of which is a non-null but possibly-empty in-order List of fields
115     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O problem or the data is malformed
116     */
117    public static DDNTemperatureDataCSV parseDDNTemperatureDataCSV(final Reader r)
118        throws IOException
119        {
120        if(null == r) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
121
122        // Wrap a buffered reader around the input if not already so.
123        final BufferedReader br = (r instanceof BufferedReader) ? (BufferedReader)r :
124                new BufferedReader(r, 8192);
125
126        // Initially-empty result...
127        // As of 2023-06-08, largest non-daily-cadence data CSV is 203 lines.
128        final ArrayList<List<String>> result = new ArrayList<>(256);
129
130        String row;
131        while(null != (row = br.readLine()))
132            {
133                // Skip empty rows.
134                if("".equals(row)) { continue; }
135                // Skip anything other than data rows starting with a date.
136                if(!row.startsWith("2")) { continue; }
137            final String fields[] = delimCSV.split(row);
138            if(fields.length < 1) { continue; }
139
140            if(fields[0].isEmpty())
141                { throw new IOException("unexpected empty date"); }
142
143            // Memory micro-optimisation.
144            // Where possible, share duplicate values from the previous row.
145            if(OPTIMISE_MEMORY_IN_CSV_PARSE && !result.isEmpty())
146                    {
147                    final List<String> prevRow = result.get(result.size() - 1);
148                    if(fields.length == prevRow.size())
149                            {
150                            for(int i = fields.length; --i >= 0; )
151                                    {
152                                final String fi = fields[i];
153                        // Else if this matches the item from the previous row, reuse it.
154                                    final String pi = prevRow.get(i);
155                                                if(fi.equals(pi)) { fields[i] = pi; }
156                                    }
157                            }
158                    }
159
160            // Package up row data (and make it unmodifiable).
161            result.add(Collections.unmodifiableList(Arrays.asList(fields)));
162            }
163
164        result.trimToSize(); // Free resources...
165        return(new DDNTemperatureDataCSV(Collections.unmodifiableList(result))); // Make outer list unmodifiable...
166        }
167
168        /**Load from GZIPped file degreedays.net hourly temperature data; never null but may be empty.
169         * @throws IOException  if file not present or unreadable/unparseable.
170         */
171        public static DDNTemperatureDataCSV loadDDNTemperatureDataCSV(final File gzippedCSV)
172            throws IOException
173            {
174                if(null == gzippedCSV) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
175                try(final Reader r = new InputStreamReader(
176                                new GZIPInputStream(
177                                        new BufferedInputStream(
178                                                new FileInputStream(gzippedCSV))), TEMPDATACSV_CHARSET))
179                    { return(parseDDNTemperatureDataCSV(r)); }
180            }
181        }
